Counties allocated an average of 7.3% of budgets to agriculture.
[The allocation to agriculture] is an increase of 0.6% from what was reported last year.
[The counties are striving] to reach the 10% [allocation to agriculture] recommended by the Malabo declaration.
Counties have over the past year sustained an average allocation of 24% of their total budgets to the health sector.
Water coverage now stands at 63% from 57%.
Sanitation coverage is now at 25%, from 16%.
County governments have continued to adhere to the two-thirds gender principle. Three counties of Kilifi, Nyeri and Migori have gone higher and have a 50/50 representation of male and female CECs.
